newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Cintra sees $2 bln 1996 sales.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Cintra sees $2 bln 1996 sales.

text.p: Cintra, the Mexican holding company for airlines Aeromexico, Mexicana de Aviacion and Aeroperu, estimated its 1996 sales at $2 billion, the company chief said on Wednesday.
"Our total sales for 1996 will reach $2 billion, and foreign sales alone will be $700 million," Guillermo Quiroz, CEO at Cintra, said in a meeting with equities analysts.
Cintra hopes to become a steady generator of foreign currency by year's end and will have diversified its risks through operations by its subsidiaries, Quiroz said.
Cintra was incorporated in May as a holding company for airlines Aeromxico, Mexicana and Aeroper, with the aim of enhancing synergies and economies of scale.

Although he recognized that Cintra, due to its recent incorporation, could not make year-ago comparisons, Quiroz estimated that the company would close 1996 with operating earnings 12 percent above those projected on the company's original share offer prospectus.
"We look like we're doing well for our first six months and are on course for a 12 percent increase in operating earnings," Quiroz said.
